ugh
So that's what we should go back with for sure. Happy to help you guys 9patch if needed, but it isn't needed.

my suspicion is that they don't know what they need

and are just saying — Umm....9 patch
Maybe he just learned what 9 patch is
anyway - let's get that search box and type up a note explaining our position

perhaps with some screens as illustration
to get explicit about — THIS IS STANDARD ANDROID BUTTON, THIS IS STANDARD ANDROID ALERT
and see where it gets us
i called those things out in the documentation

seems like a good time to share this comment, in case it makes us feel any better at all. "Energous (as in Dejan) also acknowledged again that it’s not the wisest use of our/your time to begin with, but it’s who they have to work with now…"
but i did not use all caps
ha
that was from yesterday, before the 9-patch follow-up
*BOLD ALL CAPS*
it would be helpful if shailendra at least looked at that handoff doc
and also i thought that shailendra was doing iOS
and someone else is doing android?
right
agreed with that too
I also was wondering why we were sending him Android stuff yesterday...
Does this not defeat the purpose of redesigning the whole app for Android for a seperate team?
just to make sure I'm saying this correctly

I talked with the team, and I guess our biggest question/concern is that we don’t understand why they would need all assets in 9-patch. The only thing we could see him needing 9-patch for is the search box on the list view. We could do that, but the buttons in the app are meant to be standard android buttons, as noted in our handoff doc. For the remainder of the assets, the 9-patch comment doesn’t apply. 

Has Shailendra read the hand-off doc? (Also, is he now managing both iOS and Android development?).
that seems good. Maybe we ask to hop on line with Shailendra to discuss?

when we say "For the remainder of the assets, the 9-patch comment doesn’t apply." does that mean that they can't be in 9-patch format, or that it wouldn't make sense for them to be (i.e, they shouldn't auto-scale)
I think the telephone game is part of what's happening here
the latter
doesn't make sense
it wouldnt make sense
okay, got it
they're all standard
that's what I thought but wanted to make sure
9-patch is for things like buttons where they need to be scalable because different lengths of text might need to go in them
gotcha
thanks
<!channel>: hey guys! I invited you to a shailendra call

Question <@U0260V1BX>: we're using "Minutes till 100%" in the center of the Charging graphic, but are we displaying current battery percentage once it goes to the Not Charging state? We can't continue to use "Minutes till 100%" when it's no longer charging, but we still have the 5% increment issue...
right, we are supposed to show battery percentage when not charging
damnit
thats the only thing we could possibly show
I think at some point there needs to be a percentage shown
unless its like :grinning: :neutral_face:  :worried:
DONE!
:dizzy_face:
:rage2:
* rage *
Has anyone else been testing other battery charging apps to see what they do if using 5% increments... if that is actually a thing other apps are doing?
check out battery doctor -
<https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/battery-doctor-must-have-battery/id615987910?mt=8>

right, have you had a chance to work on that at all?
they are expecting that first thing this week

That's what I'm asking about
gotcha

So <@U0289USNA>, don't know what you've been told about this situation, but to bring you up to speed, the client claims that Apple's API for this will only allow for 5% battery charge increments. Other API's apparently allow for 1% but the client says they don't want to rely on a non-Apple API in the case that something goes wrong with a 3rd party API. Do you know of any workaround on Apple's API with this?
<@U0265G76F>: did you see that link that shailendra sent over? <http://www.tidev.io/2014/02/12/android-splash-screens-using-9-patch-images/>

attachments.title: Android Splash Screens - Using 9-Patch Images
attachments.text: Learn how to use 9-patch images for your splash screens. 9-patch images can reduce the number of variations required to support numerous devices with differing resolutions and aspect ratios.
attachments.fallback: TiDev: Android Splash Screens - Using 9-Patch Images

where you define the outer edges as stretchable
gotcha

that seems unnecessary

my guess is they're all about Android = 9 patch always
no matter what
forget the spec doc - 9 patch that stuff

meaning it can go portrait/landscape (though I'd recommend just sticking portrait)
